resources.string: What\'s the email you signed up with?
We\'ve just sent you an email with your new password.
Today you\'ll have beautiful weather, conducive to surprassing oneself.
You had a lot of disturbance these past nights but your sleep debt is fine. You\'ve slept less than 85% of the time you were on bed, trying to sleep. This results in getting less restorative sleep.
Which cause might this be related to? Check one
It’s recommended to take 10 000 steps a day. This month your average was 6 450 steps a day. We can track your steps and remind you every now and then to go for a walk.
Let me fix that for you.
Do you want to activate daily step tracking?
Do you confirm that you wish to soft reset your ring?

You will go back to factory settings and all of your data will be erased.
Add, delete or discover new circles

You woke up near the end of your light sleep phase which is the best moment to feel good upon wake up.
Time interval between each snooze. Press the button once to snooze. Press it twice to completely stop the vibrations.
Time interval between each snooze. Vibrations will stop once the ring has detected that you’re up and standing.
Maximum time window for smart alarm to ring before selected wake up time. More time means more chances to get the lightest wake up.

Calculated in minutes, they correspond to the time you were awake during your sleep.

The minutes are added up in the morning and help to calculate real sleep. Waking up several times during your sleep is natural but too much time awake might reflect sleeping disorders or overall poor sleep quality.

The displayed percentage corresponds to how much you have been awake during the time you were supposed to be sleeping. More than 20% of the time is considered unhealthy and might be caused by many internal or external factors.

Real sleep is a derivative of sleep efficiency. It reflects the time you actually slept during your sleep period. In fact, it evaluates your disturbances since real sleep is total sleep minus disturbances.

It is a great indicator of overall sleep quality as a sleep efficiency percentage that is too high reflects many disturbances (internal or external factors keeping you awake).

Anything below 80% is considered poor and will negatively impact your sleep quality score. Reciprocally, a real sleep score over 90% is excellent. Anything in between is average!

It determines how much you have moved during your sleep (in total volume).\n\nAn agitated night is often a sign of bad sleeping habits. We divide the score you see in 3 indicators: agitated, still and peaceful.

Our circadian rhythm is basically a 24-hour internal clock that is running in the background of your brain and cycles between sleepiness and alertness at regular intervals.

It's also known as your sleep/wake cycle. It is tremendously important to sleep and wake up at the same time each day as it impacts directly your overall sleep quality.

Kali will compare automatically your usual sleep schedule to your weekly history to determine whether you are following your rhythm or not. The classification has 3 stage: Poor, average or optimal.

REM sleep is the phase which is responsible for restoration and memory consolidation.

The displayed percentage is your night's total REM sleep time divided by your night's real sleep.

The recommended average for adults depends on a lot of factors including age for example (between 20 and 25% of your night).

Kali knows your needs and will take into consideration if you had enough REM or if you are deprived of it to measure overall sleep quality.

It is the phase that allows the reparation of muscles and tissues, that stimulates growth and development, boosts immune function, and builds up energy for the next day. The displayed percentage is your night's total REM sleep time divided by your night's real sleep.

Kali knows your needs and will take into consideration if you had enough deep sleep or if you are deprived of it to measure overall sleep quality.

Anything below 15% deep sleep during your night is considered very poor and anything above 20% is considered sane!

Better known as sleep latency, it is the length of time that it takes to accomplish the transition from full wakefulness to sleep.

Your time to fall asleep can be modified by external or internal factors such as caffeine or screens before going to bed.

Kali calculates a baseline sleep latency which corresponds to a sleep latency average during a normal week. Variations from this baseline indicate factors influencing it and directly impacts your sleep quality.

Kali combines your night's latency compared to your baseline latency with scientific norms to give a score (the progression bar you see). Sleep specialists agree to say that a sleep latency below 5 minutes is not normal and anything above 30 minutes is too much.

Sleep debt is the cumulative effect of not getting enough sleep or getting to much sleep.\n\nEither one is bad for your body. Sleep debt looks at how much you have actually slept (real sleep) compared to your personal sleeping length needs. Any deviation from your personal needs whether more or less sleep will impact negatively your sleep debt indicator.
Each circle corresponds to a ring\'s feature. You can add or delete them at will depending on what you need
These shortcuts allow you to quickly get access to the settings you change often.\n\nYou can organize them as you wish in the « Quick access » section in the menu.
Depending on which circles you choose, your feed will display related information.

Welcome,
I'm Kira, your personal assistant.

I'll sometimes ask you questions in order to improve over time and to recommend you at best.
After 5 log edit or adition this month you won\'t aooear in the leaderboards
